page.title: 20LOCAL HISTORY
page.content: Some important dates in the story of Horncastle: 4A.D.Roman Invasion. 1200 A.D.The Church is built. 1571A.D.The Grammar School is built. 1631A.D.The Black Death kills 1/4 of the people. 1790A.D.The Canal is built. 1808-1820 A.D.Most of the land is enclosed. 1855 A.D.The Railway is constructed. The Romans invaded the area in the 4th Century A.D. They built Horncastle with a wall around it and parts of this can still be seen today. In Mediaeval Times the Horsefair was started. People came from all over the world to buy their horses. The market has now declined into a cattle market which is much smaller.{ The canal was constructed before the railway to transport goods but fell into disuse as the railway became more popular. It was closed in the 1950s and is now a nature trail.
